required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: His Bundle Recording From Subclavian Vein
clinical_study.official_title: Obtaining His Bundle Recording From the Subclavian Vein in Patients Undergoing Permanent Pacemaker Implantation

brief_summary.textblock: His bundle pacing has been proposed as a superior alternative to standard right ventricular pacing. The purpose of this study is to investigate whether obtaining a His Bundle recording from the subclavian vein using a stylet driven pacemaker lead and commercially available sheath can be done in a quick and reliable manner. This would support the use of stylet driven leads for His bundle pacing.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this prospective observational study is to investigate whether obtaining a His Bundle recording from the subclavian vein using a stylet driven pacemaker lead and commercially available sheath can be done in a quick and reliable manner. Included in the study are patients undergoing permanent pacemaker implantation at Good Samaritan and Bethesda North Hospitals. The main outcome is successful recording of a His bundle potential. Secondary outcomes are the time necessary to record the His bundle and the measurement of the pacing threshold.

primary_outcome.measure: Successful recording of a His bundle potential
primary_outcome.time_frame: From beginning of procedure to the end
primary_outcome.description: The pacing lead will be connected to a standard EP recording system (GE CardioLab, LS Pro, or EP Med) a copy of the intracardiac electrograms demonstrating His bundle recording will be saved electronically.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time necessary to record the HIS bundle
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From insertion of the pacing lead until successful measurement of HIS bundle
secondary_outcome.description: Both the procedural and fluoroscopy time from insertion of the pacing lead until successful measurement of the His bundle

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From beginning of procedure to the end of procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Threshold will be measured in volts at 1 millisecond and recorded for selective His bundle capture, non-selective His bundle capture, and ventricular septal capture as appropriate for each patient. The measurement of a normal His Bundle threshold is < 2.0 V at 1.0 ms.

study_pop.textblock: Patients undergoing permanent pacemaker implantation identified by the TriHealth Heart Institute Electrophysiologists

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

Exclusion Criteria:
